com.arakelian.retry

Class RetryerBuilder<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arakelian.retry.RetryerBuilder<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - result of a Retryer's call, the type of the call return value

    public class RetryerBuilder<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    A builder used to configure and create a Retryer.

      • withWaitStrategy

        public RetryerBuilder<V> withWaitStrategy(@Nonnull
                                          WaitStrategy waitStrategy)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the wait strategy used to decide how long to sleep between failed attempts. The default strategy is to retry immediately after a failed attempt.
        Parameters:
        waitStrategy - the strategy used to sleep between failed attempts
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a wait strategy has already been set.

      • withStopStrategy

        public RetryerBuilder<V> withStopStrategy(@Nonnull
                                          StopStrategy stopStrategy)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the stop strategy used to decide when to stop retrying. The default strategy is to not stop at all .
        Parameters:
        stopStrategy - the strategy used to decide when to stop retrying
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a stop strategy has already been set.

      • withBlockStrategy

        public RetryerBuilder<V> withBlockStrategy(@Nonnull
                                           BlockStrategy blockStrategy)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the block strategy used to decide how to block between retry attempts. The default strategy is to use Thread#sleep().
        Parameters:
        blockStrategy - the strategy used to decide how to block between retry attempts
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a block strategy has already been set.
